Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the event logs for each case Starting with Case C001 The activities are Initiate Request Verify Documents Call Customer Submit Additional Verify Documents again then Approve Request So here Verify Documents occurs twice The first time the context is initial verification where the agent checks identity documents The second time after the customer submits additional docs it is a recheck So those two Verify Documents should be differentiated Similarly in C002 and C003 there are multiple Call Customer and Adjust Account activities

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So repeating activities per case For each case C001 Verify Documents twice Call Customer once C002 Call Customer occurs twice C003 Verify Documents occurs twice So across all cases The repeating activities within a single case are In C001 Verify Documents occurs twice In C002 Call Customer occurs twice In C003 Verify Documents occurs twice

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For example in Case C001 First Verify Documents Agent checks identity documents verification incomplete leads to calling customer Second Verify Documents Agent rechecks documents now that ID scan is provided So same activity name but different context initial verification vs reverification after additional docs submitted Similarly in Case C002 First Call Customer Outbound call to clarify discrepancy second call is followup confirmation In Case C003 First Verify Documents Physical verification of ID at branch second verification after account adjustment

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Possible renaming ideas For Verify Documents in initial check vs recheck Maybe Initial Document Verification and ReVerify Documents For Call Customer when it is first contact versus followup In C002s first call is for clarification second is confirmation so maybe Clarification Call and Confirmation Call In Case C001s first call is to request missing docs so perhaps Request Missing Docs Call In Case C003s call is because customer stepped out officer calls them to return so maybe Recall Customer Call

Name: Deductive Reasoning - IND
Text: But the main focus is on activities that repeat within the same case with different contexts Therefore only focus on those that repeat within a single case Thus for each case Case C001 has two Verifies need to rename those two instances differently Case C002 has two Calls rename those two instances differently Case C003 has two Verifies rename those two instances differently Other activities like Initiate Request appear multiple times across cases but same name but since they are not repeated within a single case they dont need renaming

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Now lets process each case one by one Starting with Case C001 Original Activities 1 Initiate Request 2 Verify Documents 3 Call Customer 4 Submit Additional 5 Verify Documents 6 Approve Request The two Verifications here are first initial check leading to missing docs second after customer submits additional docs Rename first as Initial Document Verification second as Additional Document ReVerification Alternatively perhaps more precise terms based on context descriptions First Verification Context Agent checks identity documents Second Verification Context Agent rechecks documents now that ID scan is provided So possible names First Initial Identity Verification Second Additional Document Review

Name: Validation - IND
Text: Another thing to note is the resource performing the activity might influence naming For example in Case C001 both Verifications are done by BackOfficeAgent but maybe not relevant unless resource role changes meaning in this case both are BackOfficeAgent so probably not necessary for differentiation unless needed based on context alone
